description: Returns a list of Amazon OpenSearch Service package versions, along with their creation time, commit message, and plugin properties (if the package is a zip plugin package). For more information, see Custom packages for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

parameters.name: PackageID
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the package.

nested_items.name: PackageID
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the package.

nested_items.name: PackageVersionHistoryList
nested_items.description: A list of package versions, along with their creation time and commit message.

nested_items.name: CommitMessage
nested_items.description: A message associated with the package version when it was uploaded.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time when the package was created.

nested_items.name: PluginProperties
nested_items.description: Additional information about plugin properties if the package is a ZIP-PLUGIN package.

nested_items.name: ClassName
nested_items.description: The name of the class to load.

nested_items.name: UncompressedSizeInBytes
nested_items.description: The uncompressed size of the plugin.

nested_items.name: PackageConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration details for a specific version of a package.

nested_items.name: LicenseRequirement
nested_items.description: The license requirements for the package.

nested_items.name: LicenseFilepath
nested_items.description: The relative file path for the license associated with the package.

nested_items.name: ConfigurationRequirement
nested_items.description: The configuration requirements for the package.

nested_items.name: RequiresRestartForConfigurationUpdate
nested_items.description: This indicates whether a B/G deployment is required for updating the configuration that the plugin is prerequisite for.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Send the request again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.
